Topic.Title: Ready for Earnings in 2 weeks

Message.Msg: I added at 10.10 but did not when it went to 9.87. Just wanted to keep some margin power. So I added calls when it was in the 9.95 neighborhood. The margin was used up because I sold 100 contracts of $11 put averaging about 75 cents, for next week expiration, and I sold too too many puts on Etfc Jan2014/2015 $10/$12 strikes. Also, I sold 160 contracts of CY $11 puts for this month, and numerous Sept. and Jan14 CY puts, plus more puts on CRUS etc. I closed INTC and ORCl puts at a small profit, too early, but had to do it since ETFC was disappointing, going to $9.87 to pose danger to my margin balance level. In any case, the foreclosure is to become a relic. See http://money.cnn.com/2013/04/11/real_estate/foreclosures/

Topic.Title: Senators were told Iraqi weapons could hit U.S.

Message.Msg: Yep, just have all your income as Capital gains and make less than $200k a year and tax free income can be yours too . . . or tax free losses if the market moves against you. Investment income suffers a degree of risk that regular working income doesn't, and therefore deserves to be taxed differently, something with which President Obama apparently agrees as he left untouched the 100% long term gains exemptions individual incomes less than a quarter million a year. Frankly it's how I've gotten away with paying little to no federal tax since 2001 despite doing fairly well with my brokerage account from when I opened it until I mostly withdrew from the market in 2007 ahead of the housing collapse. I got back in 2009 after Obama was elected and haven't had a positive net gains year since then. I was investing in the wrong companies. The one's I invested in didn't have significant government patronage and minimum regulatory oversight as the companies that have created this new market bubble have.

Topic.Title: Short Interest as of 3/28/13

Message.Msg: Right, NORMALLY a place would accumulate a position over time, giving them a spectrum of buys along their buy range and sales along their sell range, however Citadel wanted to make a point by, essence if not in fact, dumping their entire holdings in a public and messy manner. However they weren't just going to come up with a "sale plan" and so they did the sale on a subscription basis at a slight discount on what was then retail. IF they would have dumped all those shares on the open market then STOPs would have been taken out, the price would have almost bottomed, shorts would have covered on the cheap, and longs would have felt the Citadel action to be entirely vindictive. Which, in reality, it was as I think they could have gotten more by slowly winding down their position than by even selling it at subscription.

Topic.Title: another crazy white man on a killing rampage

Message.Msg: this is perhaps the first mass killing rampage....crazy white man, 1927 : Andrew Philip Kehoe (February 1, 1872 – May 18, 1927) was an American farmer and treasurer of his township school board, notable as a mass murderer for killing his wife, and 43 other people (including 38 children), and injuring 58 people by setting off bombs in the Bath School Disaster on May 18, 1927. He committed suicide near the school by detonating dynamite in his truck, causing an explosion which killed several other people and wounded more. He had earlier set off incendiary devices in his house and farm, destroying all the buildings, as well as two horses and other animals.

Message.Title: The truth about Richard
Message.Msg: "JACKSON HOLE, WY—A team of doctors responsible for the care of #$%$ Cheney revealed Thursday that for the past few years, the former vice president has burned through a minimum of three hearts every week. “Within a time span of 48 hours or so, Mr. Cheney generally exhausts his heart until it is totally unusable, at which point he comes in for a fresh heart transplant to get him through the next few days,” said cardiac surgeon Dr. Anthony Griener, noting that when a spent heart is pulled from Cheney’s thoracic cavity, it generally emerges smoldering, shriveled, and completely black, at times also secreting a corrosive, viscous brown liquid. “He’s had so many transplants at this point that we no longer even have to apply general anesthesia or make a new incision for the procedure. He comes in, we chat with him for a bit while we pry open his chest, and we insert a fresh heart. Then he’s on his way.” Doctors also revealed that Cheney is thriving under these conditions and will likely continue to live for many, many, many years to come." The Onion

Topic.Title: A gop DA pushes for gun controls

Message.Msg: The devil is as always in details. "The Attorney General’s office argued that the Supreme Court’s Lawrence decision didn’t apply to cases involving minors. But 4th Circuit Appeals Court Judge Robert King, who wrote the majority opinion, said the Lawrence decision rendered the Virginia sodomy statue “facially” or completely unconstitutional. He stated other laws could be used to prosecute an adult for engaging in sex with a minor and that the Virginia General Assembly would likely have authority under the Lawrence decision to pass a new law specifically outlawing sodomy between an adult and a minor." So, it's OK for you even if the case involves a minor?
